document_title: Postpartum infection: Causes, symptoms and consequences
subsection_content: Postpartum infection or puerperal infection is a condition in which the private area becomes infected during the postpartum period. Bacteria enter the genitals through the bloodstream, upstream from the vagina and cervix through damage to the genital tract during and after birth. Usually occurs in the postpartum period, 6 weeks after giving birth.
subsection_title: nhiem trung hau san.json. What is postpartum infection?
subsection_data:
nhiem trung hau san.json. What is postpartum infection?
Postpartum infection or puerperal infection is a condition in which the private area becomes infected during the postpartum period. Bacteria enter the genitals through the bloodstream, upstream from the vagina and cervix through damage to the genital tract during and after birth. Usually occurs in the postpartum period, 6 weeks after giving birth.
